application.pane

Interface PaneReplacer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaFXAppController, PaneAnimationHandler

    public interface PaneReplacer
    This interface manages the loads of independent panes, by loading their .fxml files and their according Controllers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default javafx.scene.layout.Pane getPane(java.lang.String pathToFXML)
      The method gets a path to .fxml file and returns the according Pane to it.
      default void replaceWith(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane parentContainer, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorRoot, java.lang.String pathToFXML)
      This method replaces an AnchorPane with an another AnchorPane that is the root of a given .fxml file.

    • Method Detail

      • getPane

        default javafx.scene.layout.Pane getPane(java.lang.String pathToFXML)
        The method gets a path to .fxml file and returns the according Pane to it.
        Parameters:
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file the user wishes to load.
        Returns:
        the according Pane the user wishes to show to the screen.

      • replaceWith

        default void replaceWith(javafx.event.ActionEvent event,
                         javafx.scene.layout.StackPane parentContainer,
                         javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane anchorRoot,
                         java.lang.String pathToFXML)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method replaces an AnchorPane with an another AnchorPane that is the root of a given .fxml file.

        Note: this is implemented with Timeline Animation for graphical purposes only, but could also be implemented without it.

        Parameters:
        event - the encountered ActionEvent.
        parentContainer - the parent Container of the AnchorPane to be replaced.

        Important: Must be a StackPane.

        anchorRoot - the new AnchorPane to be replaced with.

        Note: this AnchorPane should be the root of the .fxml file.

        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file of the AnchorPane.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an Error.
